articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Quarantined passengers finally allowed to leave coronavirus cruise ship
articles.description: Passengers aboard the Holland America cruise ship were finally allowed to dock in Cambodia after two weeks at sea, while a ship in Japan is still locked down. Scientists are now racing to develop a vaccine to combat the highly infectious virus.

articles.author: Julian Shen-Berro
articles.title: Journalists group asks media to report on coronavirus responsibly
articles.description: The Asian American Journalists Association points out that reports of xenophobia and discrimination toward Asians and Asian Americans have surfaced across the country.
articles.content:
The Asian American Journalists Association on Thursday called on news outlets reporting on the coronavirus outbreak to be accurate and mindful about their coverage.
In a statement, the group said growing concerns over the virus have been accompanied by incre… [+2150 chars]

articles.author: Erika Edwards
articles.title: 5 U.S. cities to start testing for coronavirus
articles.description: 5 U.S. will test patients with negative flu tests but flu-like symptoms for coronavirus, the CDC said. The coronavirus tests will monitor whether the virus is in the U.S.
articles.content:
Doctors in five U.S. cities will begin testing patients with flu-like symptoms for the new coronavirus, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said Friday.
The coronavirus test will only be given to patients who test negative for the flu. So far, the… [+3218 chars]

articles.author: Christina Farr, CNBC and Salvador Rodriguez, CNBC
articles.title: Big tech talks to WHO about coronavirus misinformation
articles.description: At Facebook on Thursday, the World Health Organization (WHO) hosted a daylong meeting with some of the largest tech leaders, including Amazon and Google, to discuss setting aside their differences to work together on solutions to the coronavirus outbreak.
articles.content:
At Facebook on Thursday, the World Health Organization (WHO) hosted a daylong meeting with some of the largest tech leaders, including Amazon and Google, to discuss setting aside their differences to work together on solutions to the coronavirus outbreak.

articles.author: Isobel van Hagen, Arata Yamamoto
articles.title: Passengers finally begin to leave coronavirus-hit cruise ship in Japan
articles.description: The Japanese Health Ministry said passengers allowed to leave must be virus-free and elderly, or have a medical condition or a windowless room on the ship.
articles.content:
Passengers on the quarantined cruise ship on the coast of Yokohama, Japan finally started disembarking on Friday, before being quarantined.
The Japanese Health Ministry said passengers allowed to leave so far must be elderly at least 80 or older or have a me… [+2721 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Traditional Chinese artist chronicles Shanghai’s battle against COVID-19
articles.description: Chinese TV reports on Fan Fumin who has completed seven paintings in traditional Chinese style that tell the story of how Shanghai responded to the threat of the deadly coronavirus.
